snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said he would seek federal permission to use much of the money to make grants and loans.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg says New York City plans to spend its first $1 billion in federal money for Hurricane Sandy recovery on loans and grants to homeowners and businesses affected by the storm, and that efforts to protect public housing and critical infrastructure will come in the future.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said he would seek federal permission to use much of the money to make grants and loans.

headline.seo: Bloomberg Targets Housing and Businesses for Storm Aid Money
headline.main: City Plans to Allot First $1 Billion in Storm Aid to Housing and Businesses
headline.print_headline: City Plans to Allot First Part of Storm Aid to Housing and Businesses
